# Frontend Development Instructions

This file provides guidelines and instructions for frontend development in this repository.

## Purpose
- Ensure consistency in frontend code quality and style.
- Provide best practices for using frameworks, libraries, and tools.
- Help contributors understand the frontend architecture.

## Usage
- Follow the established folder structure for static assets and frontend code.
- Use modern JavaScript (ES6+) and CSS standards.
- Prefer modular and reusable components.
- Document any custom logic or complex UI features.

## Best Practices
- Validate user input and handle errors gracefully.
- Optimize assets for performance (minify, compress, lazy load).
- Use semantic HTML and accessible design principles.
- Test UI changes across major browsers and devices.

## Contribution
- Submit frontend changes via pull requests for review.
- Include screenshots or demos for significant UI updates.
- Report issues or suggest improvements for the frontend workflow.

---
applyTo: "*.html,*.css,*.js"
---

## Frontend Guidelines

- Use accessibility attributes (alt text, aria labels) and color schemes.
- Use responsive design for compatibility with mobile devices.
- Validate HTML structure and semantic elements

---
For more information, refer to the main README or reach out to the maintainers.
